#summary xorg-conf module for app-admin/eselect
#labels Featured,About

= About =

*eselect-xorg-conf* is a simple module for standard [http://gentoo.org/ Gentoo Linux] tool [http://packages.gentoo.org/package/app-admin/eselect app-admin/eselect]. It allows for convenient managing of multiple _xorg.conf_'s for your Xorg server via symlinking. It is especially useful while experimenting with various video drivers or display modes.

It is quite simple result of hacking standard eselect module for kernels.

= Installation =

Get it [http://code.google.com/p/krigstasks-samling/source/browse/bin/xorg.conf.eselect here] or (hg-version could be broken) [http://code.google.com/p/krigstasks-samling/downloads/ here] and put in _/usr/share/eselect/modules_, if you feel slackish and daring (it could be broken). Otherwise use *rion* overlay.

= Usage =

Use it just like any other eselect

{{{
% sudo eselect xorg.conf show
Current xorg.conf symlink:
  /etc/X11/xorg.conf.nouveau
% sudo eselect xorg.conf list
Available xorg.conf symlink targets:
  [1]   backup
  [2]   nouveau
  [3]   nvidia
% sudo eselect xorg.conf set 3
% sudo eselect xorg.conf show
Current xorg.conf symlink:
  /etc/X11/xorg.conf.nvidia
}}}
